revised_title: Dispersion of Soluble Matter in Solvent Flowing Slowly through a Tube: A Theoretical Analysis
tldr: This article presents a theoretical analysis of the dispersion of soluble matter in a solvent flowing slowly through a tube. The author demonstrates how the dispersion is affected by convection and molecular diffusion, and provides equations to calculate the dispersion along the tube. The findings can be useful for measuring molecular diffusion coefficients and understanding the dispersion of soluble salts in blood vessels.
